body.p:
To his Excellency the Governor of
Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioner William Dean a citizen of Mercer County Kentucky, would respectfully represent to your honor that one James Sallee, aged about 23 years. Six feet high: weighing about 160 lbs: black hare: black ^pale blue^ eyes, fair complection: and one Merritt Condor, aged from 21 to 25 years. about 5 1/2 feet high, weighs 1240. lbs: back hare: blacky eyes: and dark skin: Citizens of the county aforesaid, have been guilty of homicide Committed upon the person Miss Emiline Dean, Daughter of your petitioner, on Monday the 5 day of August 1861 at the residence of your petitioner, and that the said offenders have made their escape and are now going at large -- Wherefore your petitioner prays your excellency to offer a reward to the for arrest for of said offenders: and as in duty bound your petition will ever pray.

att E. J. Polk
William ^his X mark^ Dean
Sworn to before me by William Dean this 9 Aug 1861
Chr Chinn P J M C C

To his Exl Gov MaGoffin --
Mercer Co
$300 each
Reward for James Sallee & Merrit Condor
Murder
Issd. Aug 13. 1861
